observation: Audio Connection  Skip to content NJ's Premier Stereo Systems Dealer Products All Products Amplifiers Cables CD Players DAC Headphone Integrated Amplifiers Phono Preamps Power Pre-Owned/Demo Preamplifiers Speakers Streamers Subwoofers Turntable Our Brands About Us Blog Contact Twitter Facebook Search Cart Item added to your cart View cart Check out Continue shopping Explore Now Latest News & Events View all Grimm Audio MU1 & MU2 Audio Connection is now proud to have both the MU1 and MU2 music players from Grimm Audio. This groundbreaking design and detail is the next step for your digital audio. Demos... Unleash your power. The all new PowerQuest 303, 505, and 707 power conditioners filter your power to reduce noise linearly, leaving you with safe and plentiful AC power for your audio components. All... Musical Surroundings Anniversary Promotions Special promotional pricing for Musical Surroundings brands Clearaudio, DS Audio and Hana! 1 / of Our Products John Rutan has offered the finest in home stereo at our Audio Connection campus for over 30 years. John’s goal has been the same from day one – to provide his customers customized home stereo systems that bring the excitement of a live musical experience into their homes. Read More Featured products Magnepan LRS+ Regular price $ 995.00 Sale price Unit price per Belles Aria Integrated $ 2,495.00 Aesthetix Romulus MkII CD Player/DAC $ 9,000.00 Vandersteen 3A Signature $ 6,850.00 audioconnect@verizon.net 973-239-1799 Quick links My Account Collections © 2024, Powered by Shopify Refund policy Privacy policy Shipping policy Choosing a selection results in a full page refresh. Opens in a new window.

thought: The extracted text does not immediately suggest that this is a scam website. The prices seem reasonable for high-end audio equipment, and there are no unusually low prices, unrealistic money claims, or obvious attempts to exploit psychological weaknesses. The site mentions a physical address, a phone number, and an email address. However, the email address seems to be a personal one (verizon.net) rather than a business domain, which could be a red flag. Additionally, the copyright year is 2024, which is in the future and might indicate that the information has not been updated properly.
